solution_line_template: Kevin begins the day with {initial_phones} phones and repairs {repaired_phones} by the afternoon, so Kevin still has to repair {initial_phones} - {repaired_phones} = <<{initial_phones}-{repaired_phones}={remaining_phones_after_repair}>>{remaining_phones_after_repair} phones.

A client drops off {dropped_off_phones} additional phones that require fixing, increasing the total to {remaining_phones_after_repair} + {dropped_off_phones} = <<{remaining_phones_after_repair}+{dropped_off_phones}={total_phones_after_dropoff}>>{total_phones_after_dropoff} phones.

If Kevin's coworker helps Kevin fix half of the phones, then each person needs to fix {total_phones_after_dropoff} / {helper_divisor} = <<{total_phones_after_dropoff}/{helper_divisor}={phones_per_person}>>{phones_per_person} phones.
